question: Which of the following introduced the Persian style of architecture to India by building many structures at Agra, Biana, Dholpur, Gwalior and Kiul?
explanation: The founder of Mughal empire, Babur introduced the Persian style of architecture in India by building many structures at Agra, Biana, Dholpur, Gwalior and Kiul (Aligarh), but only a few of them exist today.
